properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 10:53AM EST until January 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning has been cancelled for the following river in
Southwest Lower Michigan...

Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Southwest
Lower Michigan...

Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County
Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County

.Heavy rain last weekend continues to work through the river systems
in West Michigan. Some locations on the Grand River remain above flood
stage, with the crest currently moving through Grand Rapids. By this
afternoon, all locations should see slowly falling water levels.
Additional precipitation expected this weekend should fall mostly as
snow, which will not have a significant effect on river levels. The
following forecast is based on observed and forecast 48 hour
precipitation.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Grand River at Robinson Township until late Monday night.
* At  7:50 AM Friday the stage was 14.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 13.3 feet.
* Minor Flooding is occurring.
* Forecast, the river will continue to fall below flood stage by
early Monday morning.
* Impact, at 13.9 feet...Several homes in Vanlopik subdivision are
surrounded by water.
* Flood history, this crest is about 2 feet lower than the flood
in Feb 2018.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...Motorists should not attempt to drive around
barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.

Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local
radio... television... or NOAA Weather Radio station for further
information.

Additional weather and river information can be found on our homepage
at www.weather.gov/grr
